meanings.definition: To drag or pull something out or away.
meanings.sent1: She had to outdrag the heavy suitcase from the closet.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter had to outdrag the injured person from the burning building.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outdrag a stubborn donkey can be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outdrag the competition was evident in every step.
meanings.sent5: With all her strength, she managed to outdrag the massive rock out of the way.

meanings.definition: To surpass in a drag race.
meanings.sent1: He was determined to outdrag his opponents in the race.
meanings.sent2: The sports car managed to outdrag the other vehicles on the track.
meanings.sent3: Watching the tortoise outdrag the hare was quite unexpected!
meanings.sent4: In the final stretch, she outdragged her rival with a burst of speed.
meanings.sent5: The champion racer always knew how to outdrag the competition with skill and speed.
